Hey all. Weâ€™re trying to tune our positions to drop coral into the reef.

At what we perceive to be random times, our armâ€™s elevator winch is giving out and dropping. A few minutes later, it tries to resume its previous position.

Hereâ€™s the rio logs:

accounts.google.com

Google Drive: Sign-in

Access Google Drive with a Google account (for personal use) or Google Workspace account (for business use).

Hereâ€™s our GitHub:

github.com

GitHub - team7674/reefscape

Contribute to team7674/reefscape development by creating an account on GitHub.

Sorry for the lack of info, we really donâ€™t have any leads. Please ask questions so we can answer them, and anything helps!

Thanks in advanced, -Team 7674

Thanks for the hasty reply, though we are virtually positive it is not a circuit breaker problem. We had watched the voltage and it did not go high enough to pop it. We will certainly consider this, but we do not think itâ€™s the issue.

I updated the publicity of the google drive, sorry about that

IanRaiders:

We had watched the voltage and it did not go high enough to pop it.

You mean that the motor wasnâ€™t drawing enough current to trip the breaker, right?

Reminder that circuit breakers donâ€™t trip based on voltage, but current.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T22:07:36.109Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/4","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552201,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T22:19:05.643Z","cooked":"
EricH:

donâ€™t trip based on voltage

I saw one trip on high voltage in the test lab behind bullet-proof glass. It was like THIS and [slo-mo] but safer for the testers. [Explosions count as trips, right?]

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T22:19:05.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-TjNw0gnsOM","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7},{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWhonxstjp4","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554336,"name":"Ian Owens","username":"IanRaiders","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T18:37:06.879Z","cooked":"

Yea, Iâ€™m assuming it wasnâ€™t high enough current. Our mentor says he really doubts that itâ€™s a breaker pop, and he had his own airplane company back in the day so I trust what he says. Though, if thereâ€™s an easy way to test this, please let me know! Our competition is in two days

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T18:37:06.879Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Ian Owens","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554343,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T18:45:09.336Z","cooked":"

I canâ€™t open the logs from here. I have seen similar symptoms with our robot when motor safety kicks in when the driver stationâ€™s connectivity to the robot is poor.

This was happening frequently for us when using the new radio in 2.4GHz modeâ€¦

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T18:45:09.336Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":31.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":72147,"username":"IanRaiders","name":"Ian Owens","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36169,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/7","custom_user_title":"Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554349,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T18:51:12.875Z","cooked":"

I agree that it could be an issue with the watchdog, but given that it tries to resume after a few minutes, that would imply that itâ€™s the breaker resetting itself. I would recommend graphing the current, and then trying to reproduce this.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T18:51:12.875Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":36169,"username":"Hollisms","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/8","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554586,"name":"Ian Owens","username":"IanRaiders","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T23:30:14.203Z","cooked":"

Okay, weâ€™ll do this tomorrow or the day after. If that seems to be the problem, what should we do to fix it? Just code a current limit?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T23:30:14.203Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":19.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Ian Owens","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554587,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T23:31:17.469Z","cooked":"

Yeah, basically. You also might want to look into changing your gearing so the motor doesnâ€™t have to work as hard.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T23:31:17.469Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":19.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":72147,"username":"IanRaiders","name":"Ian Owens","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/10","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554593,"name":"Ian Owens","username":"IanRaiders","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T23:38:31.064Z","cooked":"

Alright. Our mentor doesnâ€™t seem worried about it since the issue hasnâ€™t come back up since, so we might not get to this problem for a bit.

We do have another issue, though, that I might post about.

We have a wrist thing to pick up the algae. Randomly on startup, with what we perceive to be purely random chance, the encoders think that the zero position isâ€¦ up. Very up. Our zero position needs to be in the middle of itâ€™s range of motion, and it goesâ€¦ very up. Any ideas what this could be? I can try getting you a rio log but Iâ€™d have to wait for the problem to randomly happen again

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T23:38:31.064Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Ian Owens","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554597,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T23:49:00.776Z","cooked":"

What kind of encoders are you using? If theyâ€™re motor encoders, theyâ€™re going to be reset every power cycle.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T23:49:00.776Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":72147,"username":"IanRaiders","name":"Ian Owens","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/12","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554883,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T08:51:02.032Z","cooked":"
SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

[Explosions count as trips, right?]

At that point, I think your circuit breaker became a fuse and blew rather than tripped.
But it could easily result in a trip to the ER (or worse).

We had something similar happen when our Kraken reached its 100C thermal limit. Increasing the gear ratio by 2x fixed the problem.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T11:37:54.472Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494873,"topic_slug":"motors-randomly-give-out","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28834,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"686 Bovine Intervention"},"post_url":"/t/motors-randomly-give-out/494873/14","custom_user_title":"686 Bovine Intervention","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554934,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T11:59:58.363Z","cooked":"
Richard_Sims:

We had something similar happen when our Kraken reached its 100C thermal limit.

Yeah, that motor information is missing from OPâ€™s post. But Talon FX motors (Kraken X60/X44, and Falcon 500) would do this shutdown behavior without lasting harm. If OPâ€™s using them, some thoughts:

  • How long is the motor running for? Extended practices may allow for heat buildup in a way that doesnâ€™t happen during a match.
  • Can the gear ratio be changed for more torque?
  • Is OPâ€™s team starting a run with the motors at ambient temperature? Even a fan blowing on it can make a sizable dent at quals-match-turnaround pace, let alone any Falcon/Kraken cooling port stunts.

(All of that applies to other motors too, the main difference is that other motors tend to have overheat failure modes where the motor stays dead or palpably down on power.)
